body: I have checked the Jenkins reports and they seem to be caused by some download of Karaf. Is this a known issue or could it be in anyway connected to the changes of the PR?
Don't worry that's a known issue.

@reta I was thinking about that at first but the issue I see is that the ConditionalOnMissingBean annotation is a spring boot specific annotation and cxf-rt-frontend-jaxrs module does not (and probably should not) depend on spring boot stuff...

@mswiderski you are absolutely right, I missed that (the `@Bean` annotation mislead me). Than your approach is certainly in the right direction. What concerns me is the presence of should-be-well-known bean name, like `jaxRsServerConfiguration`. I believe that replacing `@ConditionalOnMissingBean(name = "jaxRsServerConfiguration")` -> `@ConditionalOnMissingBean(Server.class)`  should have the same effect, what do you think?
@reta  updated PR to use Server.class instead of arbitrary name, thanks
Hi I added few modifications as by request. Regards
Thanks @mswiderski !

@reta excellent, thanks a lot. Any information when (and in what version) this will be available as released version? Especially looking for info about cxd compatible with spring boot 2 as we (jbpm) plan to upgrade.

I am going to backport this change to `3.2.x` maintenance branch (but it would stay on Spring Boot 1.5.x), for 3.3.0 / Spring Boot 2, we have only one hard upstream dependency (Apache Karaf 4.2.2 release) to unblock us. Unfortunately we cannot commit to any date, but we are getting there. Hope it helps, thank you.
@reta thanks for info, we look at the support for it around beginning of 2019 so hopefully we can get it aligned with 3.3.0 as soon as it comes out
LGTM
@coheigea is there an expected date for the release which would include this commit?
I hope before Xmas.
Awesome!
Changes look good - thanks again!

Hi @amarkevich,

The following methods are not used in source (main) code any more and could be removed:

StringUtils.getFirstNotEmpty
StringUtils.splitAsStream

StringUtils.getParts could also be removed, it is called here:

AbstractHttpDestination: StringUtils.getParts(credentials, " ");
PackageUtils: StringUtils.getParts(getPackageName(cls), "\\.")

For both these cases you could replace with String.split + convert the non-empty values to a List.

Finally, that leaves HttpHeadersImpl as the only place that is calling StringUtils.split. For several of the cases here it is a single character, for others not. You could move the StringUtils split functionality into this class + see if you can re-use split for the case that it's a single character, otherwise use a pre-compiled pattern separator?
I'll prepare a new PR according to proposals
LGTM

hope https://builds.apache.org/job/CXF-Trunk-PR/857/org.apache.cxf.systests$cxf-systests-ws-rm/ is not related to current changes
@coheigea Is 'Changes requested' still actual?
No the Jenkins build is just the flaky ws-rm tests, please go ahead and merge
Hi thanks for taking a look into it
@reta @dkulp any news here?

hey @davidkarlsen, it looks good overall though there are quite a few comments I would like to be addressed (they all are pretty minor, but I hope make API more clear). @coheigea could you please take a look as well?

@reta - Thanks so much for the thorough review!  I've updated the PR with a new commit (Code review comments) that addresses everything you mentioned except for putting the timeout properties in `ClientProperties` - do we need to create a new class/interface for that?
hey @andymc12 , sorry was crazy day at work, yeah I think we could create dedicated class/interface, like `ClientProperties` and move these common constants here. What do you think? Thanks a lot!

Great someone tried it earlier but this update caused build failures: [CXF-7766](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-7766?focusedCommentId=16522494&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-16522494)
yep; fixed by 2nd commit

@reta I introduced a new `ClientProperties` interface with all of the properties from `ClientImpl` - afaict, only the timeout-based properties are widely used.  Can you take another look?

Thanks again!
Thanks @andymc12, LGTM! Would be great if @rmannibucau could take a look on CDI part, thanks!
LGTM
LGTM
The PR doesn't make sense as the changes are already in master.

@rmannibucau sorry for the slow response.  Do you have (or can you provide) any examples of both 1 and 2?  My CDI knowledge is pretty limited, and I'd like to make sure this works for CDI extensions - and avoid unnecessary code if possible.  Thanks!

Hi @andymc12 , happy new year :)

about 1 maybe check out https://github.com/apache/geronimo-metrics/blob/master/geronimo-metrics/src/main/java/org/apache/geronimo/microprofile/metrics/cdi/CountedInterceptor.java#L91, it is not the best impl - which would use an extension to capture it and inject it in a specific interceptor - but a good compromise regarding the complexity. Then you have the annotated model from cdi which replaces all java reflect usages.

About 2: [1] is the one, it enables to manage the interceptors (configured) for you

Let me know - or ping me on slack/irc/gmail - if you need more pointers/help.

[1] https://docs.jboss.org/cdi/api/2.0/javax/enterprise/inject/spi/InterceptionFactory.html
+1 LGTM
+1 LGTM

Happy New Year @rmannibucau! And thanks - that helps a lot!  

I've updated the code to use CDI AnnotatedTypes which should address your first concern.

As for the second concern, I agree that the InterceptionFactory should help, but I think that it will not work (at least for wrapping the MP Rest Client instance) because it would be creating a dynamic proxy to wrap another dynamic proxy.  I'm not sure if that is possible - and I think that it falls under the [unproxyable category](http://docs.jboss.org/cdi/spec/2.0-PRD/cdi-spec.html#unproxyable).

Well there is a ticket for that at cdi level (isnt it stupid technically? ;)). But the fix can be: provide the "internal most nested impl" as a specific bean and inject this "impl bean" to the factory :). You can even do the impl as an interceptor (no more invocation handler at all) for that case with no impl and just use the factory with a bean returning null as base.
+1 - I had noticed the test failures on Jenkins.

Per discussion in Google Chat, this (suggestion 2) fails in OWB but can work in Weld.  For now, I'll plan to merge this as-is - then (after OWB is fixed) we can make these suggested changes.  Hopefully by that time, we'll also have an official release of MP Rest Client 1.2 for the APIs/TCKs.
Just for tracking purpose: OWB fix is on the snapshot so 2.0.10 will get it and the interceptor stack handling impl will be droppable
Thank you (indeed, name changed https://github.com/automatictester/wiremock-maven-plugin/commit/53845878aa9b3c62cce60365cf2390e7553644ba#diff-600376dffeb79835ede4a0b285078036)
I have done changes to the PR based on the feedback here
@coheigea have to admit i used CDI to test so commons-annotation was there (and @Priority) but good catch, updated
@coheigea fixed it, misread the getClassAnnotation method (thought the first test was on the annotation but it was on the class). Thanks for catching it.
Thanks @rmannibucau
@apache/cxf-committers can we merge this for 3.3.0? Looks like all review comments have been addressed...
@deki +1, @coheigea  what do you think? since this is an isolated module, we could get it in and improve along the way
@reta  @deki  Sure - but the PR doesn't apply for me manually on CXF trunk. @BassExtractor  can you check this please?
Why not merging it using the GitHub functionality?
Well sure if it actually applies cleanly to the current master code?
+1, thanks @amarkevich !

FYI I fixed a bug where it was passing the method to the URI parameter and vice versa for signature verification. I also added a client request filter and a bunch of systests in systests/rs-security. I'll revisit after the 3.0.0 release and add more tests etc.

@coheigea could you take a look how to fix them right way?
@amarkevich I will just remove the tests, as the server endpoint doesn't support NULL any more
While we are at it we might want to bump the minimum version of the OSGi version constraints to 5 or do you guys also want to continue support Spring 3 and 4? Let me know!

Thanks, @siepkes, it make sense to bump upper limit for OSGi. Regarding Spring 3/4, CXF does no really depend on anything beside Spring core components (we also need to play well with Spring Boot 1.5.x, which is still on Spring 4.3.x).

Besides a minor edit request, LGTM, thanks @jwcarman !
Let's see if there is any trouble with tests..

Once merged, I'd also backport to 3.1.x-fixes and 3.2.x-fixes
I added an entity type check to make sure it's still compatible with 1.5.17 also and not just the newer stuff.
@reta you're absolutely right, thx for noticing

I didn't figure it'd be a big deal, since the SwaggerSerializers and BaseApiListingResource appear to be designed to be used together (especially now since the entity type is Swagger).  We are already using BaseApiListingResource.

Im fine with it. Was just explaining my motivation. Ill update when I get
back home later.

Thanks for this PR, @mrulli, the problem is understood, I think you solution looks good.

@ffang May I ask for a review? I'm not sure whether condition "tlsServerParameters.getClientAuthentication() != null" is strong enough. Whether it is possible to want https without this parameter.Code from [1] seems that having it is the only way how to force undertow to use ssl. (other option is to check whether at least one property is not null - but it is ugly and error causing solution)

Thank you in advance,
Jiri


[1] https://github.com/apache/cxf/blob/master/rt/transports/http-undertow/src/main/java/org/apache/cxf/transport/http_undertow/UndertowHTTPServerEngine.java#L277

Hi @JiriOndrusek 

I don't think your change in that PR is correct.

"tlsServerParameters.getClientAuthentication() != null" isn't a compulsory requirement for  HTTPS protocol

Freeman
Problem is probably not in cxf. To be sure it needs more investigations

Thank you, @ivanjunckes
cause compilation error; try 'return pClass.cast(value);'
@amarkevich thks for the catch, used (T) style as other/nearer casts in this method - just for consistency.
regarding '(T) style': its used for primitives (L433, L453); 'pClass.cast(...)' used in other places

@amarkevich fair enough. Can I ask some deeper review on the "if (pClass == String.class && !adapterHasToBeUsed)" coming next the block I added, if this is important - and somehow covered/coverable in tests - then we should move to the jaxb boolean we have to test if we must try jaxb handling or bypass it cause missing. I'm not fully sure we want to keep that. My understanding is that it is to use @XmlJavaTypeAdapter on method parameter but not sure it is something used or to keep with param converter of JAX-RS.

It doesn't look like we have any test in place that would handle that particular case.   We have XmlAdapters that go from the on-the-wire string to custom types, but nothing that would go from something else on the wire to a string.     That said, I BELIEVE it's something that is supposed to be supported from the specs.
@dkulp it is not in JAX-RS spec, do you have another spec in mind?
JAXB in particular.   In any case, I just pushed a test case for it.  :)

JAXB has no word about JAX-RS so don't think so as well, it is a CXF specific feature AFAIK
will close this one to open another PR (using my IDE instead of github online edit since it needs more work than I thought)
thanks guys for the feedback
@reta agree, your fix is better than my proposal which was ignoring suspended case. Thanks a lot to work on it.
@reta done and thanks for the catch, completely forgot this point!
Thanks for review, @coheigea , sorry I didn't get the whitespace changes thingy, could you please clarify a bit, thanks a lot!
@coheigea done, the patch applies smoothly now, thanks!

Hi @reta

When working on tomee or cdi based servers i always wondered why this part of the code was not:

1. An extension of the bus allowing to cache the mapping - ClassUnwrapper only?
2. A chain of predicates instead of a single impl which is hard to do right or precise enough for all impls - bytebuddy ones are custom for instance so not manageable ; mixed in an app with spring or a cdi impl you are forced to know all apps internals :(

Guess default can also change since superclass name is often in the proxy name for $$ kind of proxies which enables to keep lambd aand add cglib logic.

Hope it makes sense.

Hi @rmannibucau ,

Thanks a lot for the review, yeah indeed this is pretty old class, purely Spring-specific. I remember we have discussed this awhile back, when `ClassUnwrapper` / `CdiClassUnwraper` were introduced. Agree that the responsibilities are now half-splitted between `ClassHelper` and `ClassUnwrapper`. 

I think we could do:
1) Convert `SpringAopClassHelper` into `SpringClassUnwrapper` (we would need to add a method
`getRealClassFromClass` to `ClassUnwrapper` to handle the case when instance is not available).
2) Make `SpringClassUnwrapper` logic based on list of predicates with defaults provided (to behave like `SpringAopClassHelper` at least)

Did I get your idea right? Thanks.

Hi @reta

1. Sounds ok - we can think about having a getClassFromModel instead, cdi will need Annotated and not Class in some rare cases. For spring model is the class but it would depend the "deployer" - hiw classes are scanned/registered.
2. Almost, the list would be generic. You would get a CompositeClassUnwrapper usable in spring apps but also cdi and standalone apps. Wonder if know proxies should be handled by default or not wrapping user unwrapper hut guess with a composite reusable class taking a list of unwrappers it is not immediately needed.

Hope it is clearer

@coheigea any thoughts on this one?
BTW: Are updated snapshots pushed out anywhere? I have a library to adapt to 3.3.2
Yes see here: https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/cxf/cxf-rt-rs-security-http-signature/3.3.2-SNAPSHOT/
